intro: Sacoglottis densiflora, commonly known as the dense-flowered sacoglottis, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, pentagonal flowers that typically bloom in clusters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. Sacoglottis densiflora is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
